lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Aih Agin kau bwlk iblok DwvY gih gih rwKY mwqw suq ibllwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Ahi Agani Kau Baalak Bilok Dhaavai , Gahi Gahi Raakhai Maataa Sout Bilalaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of its shining characteristic, a child runs to catch hold of snake and fire, but his mother keeps stopping him from doing so resulting in the wailing of the child.

lines.gurmukhi: biRKwvMq jMq jYsy cwhq AKwid Kwid jqn kY bYd jugvq n suhwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Brikhaavant Jant Jaisay Chaahat Akhaadi Khaadi , Jatan Kai Baid Jougavat N Suhaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an ailing person wishes to eat food that is not good for his recovery and the physician constantly persuades him to exercise control and prevention and that helps the patient recover.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy pMQ ApMQ ibbykih n bUJY AMD kit ghy AtptI cwl cilE jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Pand Apand Bibaykahi N Boojhai Andha , Kati Gahay Atapatee Chaal Chaliao Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a blind person is unaware of the good and bad paths, and walks in a zig zag manner even by feeling the path with his walking stick.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy kwmnw krq kink Aau kwmnI kI rwKY inrlyp gurisK Akulwq hY ]369]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Kaamanaa Karat Kanik Au Kaamanee Kee , Raakhai Niralayp Gursikh Akulaat Hai ?369?

Shabad OS B.translation: So does a Sikh longs to enjoy the pleasure of a woman and others wealth and is ever anxious to possess them, but the True Guru wants to keep his Sikh free from these allurements. (369)
